intro: Plantago major var. sinuata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf plantain, is a perennial herb native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It features rosettes of narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly curled margin, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, greenish flowers in dense spikes that emerge from the center of the rosette. It is commonly found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in lawns. This species is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for its healing benefits.
